InvalidMinHoldingValueToRebalance().details: Signifies that an invalid minHoldingValueToRebalance value has been encountered.

InvalidRebalanceBPS().details: Signifies that an invalid rebalance basis points value has been encountered.

NotAutomationCalled().details: Thrown when an automation call is not made

NotImplementedInLogicContract().details: Indicates that the functionality is not implemented in the logic contract.

NotKeeperCalled().details: Thrown when the keeper is not called.

NotMarket().details: Indicates that the operation is not applicable to the market.

NotMatchDistributionLength(uint256,uint2.details: Thrown when the lengths of the fee array and distribution array do not match.

params.distributionLength: The length of the distribution array.
params.feeLength: The length of the fee array.

NotOwner().details: Signifies that the caller is not the owner of the contract

OnlyAccessableByOwner().details: Signifies that the function is only accessible by the owner

OnlyBatchCall().details: Denotes that the function can only be called within a batch call.

TooSmallAmountToAddLiquidity().details: Throws an error indicating that the amount to add liquidity is too small.

UnknownLPAction().details: Thrown when an unknown liquidity provider action is encountered

params.amount: Amount of liquidity added in the settlement token.
params.receiptId: Unique identifier for the liquidity addition receipt.
Unique identifier for the liquidity addition receipt.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

params.amount: Amount of liquidity added during rebalance.
params.currentUtility: Current utility of the liquidity provider.
params.receiptId: Unique identifier for the rebalance liquidity addition receipt.

params.currentUtility: Current utility of the liquidity pool.
params.receiptId: Unique identifier for the rebalance liquidity removal receipt.
Unique identifier for the settled rebalance receipt.

params.lpTokenAmount: Amount of LP tokens to be removed.
params.receiptId: Unique identifier for the liquidity removal receipt.
Unique identifier for the settled liquidity removal receipt.

params.automate: The address of the AutomateLP contract.

SetAutomationFeeReserved(uint256).details: Emitted when the automation fee reserved value is updated.

params.newValue: The new value of the automation fee reserved.

SetLpName(string).details: Emitted when the name of the liquidity provider is updated.

params.name: The new name of the liquidity provider.

SetLpTag(string).details: Emitted when the tag of the liquidity provider is updated.

params.tag: The new tag associated with the liquidity provider.

SetMinHoldingValueToRebalance(uint256).details: Emitted when the minimum holding value to trigger rebalance is updated.

params.newValue: The new value of the minimum holding value to rebalance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

addLiquidity(uint256,address).details: Adds liquidity to the Chromatic Protocol, minting LP tokens for the specified amount and assigning them to the recipient.

params.amount: The amount of liquidity to add.
params.recipient: The address of the recipient for the LP tokens.

returns._0: ChromaticLPReceipt A data structure representing the receipt of the liquidity addition.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity addition.
params.settlementToken: The address of the settlement token used for adding liquidity.
params.vault: The address of the vault where the liquidity is added.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity addition.
params.settlementToken: The address of the settlement token used for adding liquidity.
params.vault: The address of the vault where the liquidity is added.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

automationFeeReserved().details: Retrieves the amount reserved as automation fee for automated operations within the liquidity provider.

returns._0: The automation fee reserved amount.

cancelRebalanceTask().details: Cancels the currently active rebalance task in the liquidity provider. This is allowed for the owner of LP contract to call

cancelSettleTask(uint256).details: Cancels the settle task in the liquidity provider. This is allowed for the owner of LP contract to call

params.receiptId: The receipt ID associated with the settle execution.

checkRebalance().details: Checks whether a rebalance task is needed.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether a rebalance task is needed.

checkSettle(uint256).details: Checks whether a settle task is needed for a specific receipt ID.

params.receiptId: The unique identifier of the receipt associated with the task.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether a settle task is needed.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity claim.
params.depositedAmounts: The array of deposited liquidity amounts for each receipt in the batch.
params.feeRates: The array of trading fee rates associated with each claim in the batch.
params.mintedCLBTokenAmounts: The array of CLB token amounts minted for each receipt in the batch.
params.receiptIds: The array of the liquidity receipt IDs.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity claim.
params.feeRate: The trading fee rate associated with the liquidity claim.
params.mintedCLBTokenAmount: The amount of CLB tokens minted as liquidity.
params.receiptId: The ID of the liquidity claim receipt.

clbTokenBalances().details: Retrieves the balances of CLB tokens held in the liquidity provider.

returns._clbTokenBalances: An array of CLB token balances held in the liquidity provider.

clbTokenIds().details: Retrieves the token IDs of CLB tokens handled in the liquidity provider

returns._0: An array of CLB token IDs handled in the liquidity provider.

clbTokenValues().details: Retrieves the values of CLB tokens held in the liquidity provider.

returns._clbTokenBalances: An array of CLB token value held in the liquidity provider.

createRebalanceTask().details: Initiates the creation of a rebalance task in the liquidity provider. This is allowed for the owner of LP contract to call

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

distributionRates().details: Retrieves an array of distribution rates associated with different fee rates.

estimateMinAddLiquidityAmount().details: Estimates the minimum amount of liquidity that can be added by automation.

returns._0: The minimum amount of liquidity in the settlement token that can be added.

estimateMinRemoveLiquidityAmount().details: Estimates the minimum amount of liquidity that can be removed by automation.

returns._0: The minimum amount of liquidity in the LP token that can be removed.

feeRates().details: Retrieves the fee rates associated with various actions in the liquidity provider.

returns._0: An array of fee rates for different actions within the liquidity pool.
The address of the AutomateLP contract.

getReceipt(uint256).details: Retrieves detailed information about a specific liquidity receipt identified by id.

params.id: The unique identifier of the liquidity receipt to retrieve.

returns._0: A data structure representing the liquidity receipt.

getReceiptIdsOf(address).details: Retrieves the unique identifiers of all liquidity receipts owned by a given address.

params.owner: The address of the liquidity provider.

returns.receiptIds: An array of unique identifiers for the liquidity receipts owned by the specified address.

holdingClbValue().details: Retrieves the current holding CLB value in the liquidity provider.

returns.value: The current holding CLB value in the liquidity provider.

holdingValue().details: Retrieves the current holding value of the liquidity pool.

returns._0: The current holding value in the liquidity provider.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

longShortInfo().details: Retrieves information about the target of liquidity.

returns._0: longShortInfo An integer representing long (1), short (-1), or both side(0).

lpName().details: Retrieves the name of the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

returns._0: The name of the liquidity provider.

lpTag().details: Retrieves the tag associated with the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

returns._0: The tag associated with the liquidity provider

lpToken().details: Retrieves the address of the LP token associated with the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

returns._0: The address of the LP (Liquidity Provider) token issued by the liquidity provider.

market().details: Retrieves the address of the market associated with the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

returns._0: The address of the market associated with the liquidity provider.

minHoldingValueToRebalance().details: Retrieves the minimum holding value required to trigger rebalance.

returns._0: The minimum holding value to rebalance.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.ids: An array containing ids of each token being transferred (order and length must match values array)
params.operator: The address which initiated the batch transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.values: An array containing amounts of each token being transferred (order and length must match ids array)

returns._0: `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` if transfer is allowed

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Handles the receipt of a single ERC1155 token type. This function is called at the end of a `safeTransferFrom` after the balance has been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer, this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xf23a6e61, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.id: The ID of the token being transferred
params.operator: The address which initiated the transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.value: The amount of tokens being transferred

returns._0: `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` if transfer is allowed

pendingClbValue().details: Retrieves the pending CLB value in the liquidity provider.

returns.value: The pending CLB value in the liquidity provider.

pendingRemoveClbBalances().details: An array of pending CLB token balances for removal. Retrieves the pending CLB token balances that are pending removal from the liquidity provider.

pendingValue().details: Retrieves the pending value of the liquidity provider.

returns._0: pendingValue The pending value in the liquidity pool.

rebalanceBPS().details: Retrieves the rebalance basis points (BPS) for the liquidity provider.

returns._0: The rebalance BPS.

rebalanceCheckingInterval().details: Retrieves the time interval in seconds between checks for rebalance conditions.

returns._0: The rebalance checking interval in seconds.

removeLiquidity(uint256,address).details: Removes liquidity from the Chromatic Protocol, burning the specified amount of LP tokens and transferring the corresponding assets to the recipient.

params.lpTokenAmount: The amount of LP tokens to remove.
params.recipient: The address of the recipient for the withdrawn assets.

params.clbToken: The address of the Chromatic liquidity token.
params.clbTokenIds: The array of the Chromatic liquidity token IDs to be removed.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity removal.

params.clbToken: The address of the Chromatic liquidity token.
params.clbTokenId: The ID of the Chromatic liquidity token to be removed.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity removal.

params.automate: The address of the AutomateLP contract.

setAutomationFeeReserved(uint256).details: Additional data to be used in the rebalance process.

params._automationFeeReserved: The new value for the reserved automation fee.

setLpName(string).details: Sets the name of the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

params.newName: The new name for the liquidity provider.

setLpTag(string).details: Sets the tag associated with the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

params.newTag: The new tag for the liquidity provider.

setMinHoldingValueToRebalance(uint256).details: Additional data to be used in the rebalance process.

params._minHoldingValueToRebalance: The new value for the required minimum amount to trigger rebalance.

settle(uint256).details: Initiates the settlement process for a specific liquidity receipt identified by receiptId.

params.receiptId: The unique identifier of the liquidity receipt to settle.

returns._0: true if the settlement is successful, false otherwise.

settlementToken().details: Retrieves the address of the settlement token associated with the Chromatic Protocol liquidity provider.

returns._0: The address of the settlement token used in the liquidity provider.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalClbValue().details: Retrieves the total CLB value in the liquidity provider, combining holding and pending CLB values.

returns.value: The total CLB value in the liquidity provider.

totalValue().details: The total value of the liquidity provider

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

utilization().details: The current utilization of the liquidity provider, represented in basis points (BPS)

utilizationTargetBPS().details: Retrieves the target utilization rate in basis points (BPS) for the liquidity provider.

returns._0: The target utilization rate in BPS.

valueInfo().details: Retrieves the total value of the liquidity provider, including both holding and pending values.

returns.info: A ValueInfo struct containing total, holding, pending, holdingClb, and pendingClb values.

params.burnedCLBTokenAmounts: The array of CLB token amounts burned for each receipt in the batch.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.feeRates: The array of trading fee rates associated with each withdrawal in the batch.
params.receiptIds: The array of the liquidity receipt IDs.
params.withdrawnAmounts: The array of withdrawn liquidity amounts for each receipt in the batch.

params.burnedCLBTokenAmount: The amount of CLB tokens burned during the withdrawal.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.feeRate: The trading fee rate associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.receiptId: The ID of the liquidity withdrawal receipt.
params.withdrawnAmount: The amount of liquidity that has been withdrawn.

RebalanceAddLiquidity(uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Emitted when rebalance of adding liquidity is performed.

RebalanceRemoveLiquidity(uint256,uint256.notice: Emitted when rebalance of removing liquidity is performed.

SetAutomateLP(address).notice: Emitted when the AutomateLP address is set.

addLiquidityBatchCallback(address,addres.notice: Handles the callback after adding liquidity to the Chromatic protocol.

addLiquidityCallback(address,address,byt.notice: Handles the callback after adding liquidity to the Chromatic protocol.

claimLiquidityBatchCallback(uint256[],in.notice: Handles the callback after claiming liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

claimLiquidityCallback(uint256,int16,uin.notice: Handles the callback after claiming liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

getAutomateLP().notice: Gets the current AutomateLP contract address.

removeLiquidityBatchCallback(address,uin.notice: Handles the callback after removing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

removeLiquidityCallback(address,uint256,.notice: Handles the callback after removing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

withdrawLiquidityBatchCallback(uint256[].notice: Handles the callback after withdrawing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

withdrawLiquidityCallback(uint256,int16,.notice: Handles the callback after withdrawing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.
